metadata.title: CVE-2023-5869 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in PostgreSQL that allows authenticated database users toexecute arbitrary code through missing overflow checks during SQL arrayvalue modification. This issue exists due to an integer overflow duringarray modification where a remote user can trigger the overflow byproviding specially crafted data. This enables the execution of arbitrarycode on the target system, allowing users to write arbitrary bytes tomemory and extensively read the server's memory.

criterions.comment: postgresql-9.5: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
